    Vietnamese Chicken Cabbage Salad
back to cookbook
Light And Refreshing

Vietnamese Chicken Cabbage Salad

5
Average: 5 (4 votes)
(4 votes)
Rate recipe
Show all reviews

Vietnamese Chicken Cabbage Salad - This colorful chicken and vegetable salad is a culinary trip to the Far East.

Save
share Share
print
bookmark_border Copy URL
mailE-Mail
Difficulty:
easy
Difficulty
Preparation:
40 min.
Preparation

Healthy, because

Even smarter

This salad is a well rounded dish filled with nutrient rich vegetables, protein rich chicken, and fat rich peanuts. It fills you up easily and contains numerous health benefits that contribute to a healthy body.

You can serve this as a main dish because it is extremely filling, our you can serve smaller portions for a great appetizer or side dish.

Author of this recipe:
EAT-SMARTER
all recipes of this author

Ingredients

for
4
Ingredients
24 ozs Chicken broth
22 ozs Chicken breasts
3 carrots (10-12 ounces)
1 bunch Radish
1 Red chili pepper
1 Chinese cabbage
1 bunch mixed Fresh herbs (such as mint, basil)
1 Lime
3 Tbsps chopped Peanuts
2 Tbsps vegetable oil
peppers
How healthy are the main ingredients?
Chicken breastRadishcarrotLimePeanuts
back to cookbook
print shopping list

Preparation steps

1.

Bring broth to a boil, add chicken and simmer for about 20 minutes on low heat.

2.

Peel carrots and cut into thin, long strips. Rinse and dry radishes, cut into thin slices. Rinse and chop chile pepper. 

3.

Rinse and dry cabbage, cut into fine strips. Rinse and shake dry herbs, pluck off leaves. 

4.

Remove chicken from broth and cool. Squeeze lime juice. 

5.

Cut meat into thin strips, mix with prepared vegetables and herbs, drizzle with lime juice and oil, season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with nuts. Serve.

Cabbage
Don’t let cabbage fool you— while it may be commonly thought of as a lowly, satiating side dish, cabbage is a fantastic vegetable which has a ton of culinary and nutritional benefits to offer.
Savoy Cabbage
With its flowery, veined leaves, savoy cabbage is one of the prettier cabbages, and one of the tastiest as well. In recent years its delicate taste and numerous health benefits have made it an increasingly popular vegetable for home cooks and professional chefs alike. ​
